definition: fence (esp. of bamboo or wood railings)
an article made of bamboo strips/fence

sentences.english: Bamboo fence that lines the dying rose, hurt people 's heart.
sentences.chinese: 竹篱笆旁那株即将凋谢的玫瑰，刺痛了路人的心。

sentences.english: My neighbor and I built a fence between our backyards.
sentences.chinese: 我和邻居在后院建了个篱笆。

sentences.english: The farmer fenced in his garden .
sentences.chinese: 农夫将他的花园用篱笆围起。

sentences.english: It was white that Tom was painting the fence.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆当时正在把篱笆涂成白色的。

sentences.english: She lived in a band under a hedge.
sentences.chinese: 她住在灌木篱笆下面的田埂里。

sentences.english: The leaves, still green, tossed off the hedgerow trees by the wind.
sentences.chinese: 仍然是绿色的叶子吹得从灌木篱笆上飘落下来。

sentences.english: The boy cleared the fence in one leap.
They ran a fence around the house.
sentences.chinese: 他们在住宅四周修建起一圈篱笆墙。

sentences.english: But when he got acrossthe hedge, he hurt his heel.
sentences.chinese: 但当他越过篱笆的时候，他的脚后跟受伤了。

sentences.english: A wattled hedge surrounds the house.
sentences.chinese: 房子四周围绕着一圈篱笆障。

sentences.english: The fence remained intact but the ram injured its own horns.
sentences.chinese: 结果篱笆纹丝不动，它反把自己的犄角碰伤了。

sentences.english: Farmers may want to put up electric fences to inclose enclose grazing areas, called productspaddocks.
sentences.chinese: 牧民可能想要电篱笆以围住放牧区，这叫围场。

definition: Boston ivy or Japanese creeper (Parthenocissus tricuspidata)
to surround/to encircle/to enclose/to fence in
embankment or foothpath between paddy fields
